website_summaries.verdict: Designed primarily for commercial applications, this professional-grade detector goes beyond what most homeowners need.
cons: Not designed for home use (although home use is possible)

customer_reviews.title: Reads '4ppm' when it should read '0ppm' like my other one that's sitting right next to it
customer_reviews.text: I just bought my second one of these. The first one reads 0ppm whereas the new one reads 4ppm. Maybe the manufacturer is having issues with its calibration? Update: It is now reading '6'. I'm waiting on a reply from Sensorcon. I will update this review after I hear back from them.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Looks good and easy to operate but not accurate
customer_reviews.text: The meter read 17ppm at the register but 3 other CO detectors read 0ppm. A local Calabration company checked the CO detector and found it was inaccurate and recommended returning it for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super durable, very impressed
customer_reviews.text: I'm an EMT and bought this so I don't have to worry as much about going into unknown people's houses. I've carried this every day for about a year and it barely shows any wear. Still works perfectly and is very accurate. Battery life is great. I leave it on almost 24/7 and it's still on the original battery. Vibrate and max functions are very useful. It responds very quickly to CO and always alarms within just a few seconds. I'm very impressed with the durability and build quality. 10/10
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Johnson

customer_reviews.title: I believe I received a used unit
customer_reviews.text: Device came scratched and with obvious wear marks. I hope the thing works better than it looks.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew W

customer_reviews.title: Helped to prove CO problems in car
customer_reviews.text: Having already been the recipient of CO poisoning several years ago, I was scared fitless when I began getting horrible headaches and was smelling exhaust in my car after receiving service. This detector quickly showed the ppm of CO in the cabin of my car. The mechanic is now fixing the the problem without charge.
customer_reviews.author: nomotodo

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: It works as advertised. I used it to ensure the heat exchange on my stove was intact. After checking that it went to our rural fire district for a permanent home. really appreciate all the information offered on the product manufacture's website.
customer_reviews.author: jacob davis

customer_reviews.title: Nice device. Well made
customer_reviews.text: Nice device. Well made, you can tell it's not a piece of junk when you pick it up. I use it for checking CO levels while operating some of my older vehicles, and also for checking the CO levels in the garage. It's kinda big to carry as a key chain, but fits inside a cup holder easily. Even though we have a CO detector upstairs, my wife likes that she can walk around the basement and check for CO levels in the winter when the gas furnace and gas water heater is running a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Blitz2010

customer_reviews.title: I'm returning it, doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: It just slowly keeps climbing higher, it's up to 8 now, even if I turn it off go out side, and turn it back on, it just keeps going up. Everything in my house is electric, and even out side in the fresh air it keeps climbing up. Plus, the max button does nothing. I'm very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Set and forget
customer_reviews.text: I use this when working on my car, traveling to AirBNB's, hotels and long road trips. I leave it on at all times and keep it in my backpack. I'll take it out of my backpack when I'm working in the garage or in a place where there aren't other CO detectors (like my home). Even in my back pack, it will alert if you start a car in the garage and let it run for a couple minutes. Obviously not as effective in a backpack but it's not useless either. The clip can be removed with a single screw.
customer_reviews.author: Internet

customer_reviews.title: Very good solid built quality
customer_reviews.text: Very precise and sensitive. I use it in my small plane and it shows the slightest increase and decrease with adjustable audible alarms. Very good solid built quality...
customer_reviews.author: Capt.Jim

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for travelling!
customer_reviews.text: The device is feels sturdy and is easy to use. However, it is 100% not suitable for travelling. I bought the device so that I can check CO levels in hotel rooms I'm staying in during my frequent travels abroad for work. However, literally every time I fly with the device, it displays wildly high and inaccurate reading for hours, sometimes days, before it settles back down to normal. I spoke with a representative from the manufacturer and they confirmed this is not a defect with my individual device but rather a known issue with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime R

customer_reviews.title: HVAC tech life saver. Great investment 10 fold.
customer_reviews.text: In California Central heating is often in attic or under homes. Sometimes not easy to get out fast. Twice I found exhaust leaking without my knowledge but this detector did (IN REAL TIME!). This also helped me show my customers they have traces of Carbon monoxide even at low levels (1PPM) and watch it grow. If you work around combustion this is a must have or go old school and carry a Canary with you like they do in mining.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M. Saints N.O.

customer_reviews.title: Small and mobile, good to take readings in unknown vehicles, hotels, friends house.
customer_reviews.text: Very accurate with real time PPM’s. I used it in two of my cars to check for CO in the Cabin. I know someone who died idling her car waiting for her daughter who did a sleepover at her friends house. Apparently the CO made it way into the trunk. I imagine the fumes leaked into the cabin, she was DOA.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony N. Monti

customer_reviews.title: High quality product!
customer_reviews.text: American quality! This device works great! It's very well made and it shows! As a full-time RVer, I use it as a backup to the built-in sensor in my trailer.
customer_reviews.author: AMC

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: I like the quality of this product. As a home inspector I've only used it 3 times so far. At a home inspection, the lawn was being done at the home, when I went outside to get something I could smell the gardeners equipment. I looked at the CO2 detector and the value was high. I feel it is accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great products at an affordable price
customer_reviews.text: Meets my expectations ... direct readout for ppm and gives me assurance that the enviroment is safe.
customer_reviews.author: CatFish

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: It’s very quick and accurate. It even reads with my coat zipped up over top of it.
customer_reviews.author: David Tibbs

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding, tested in the field and found that "safe" propane heater was very unsafe. windinmyface.com/Sprinter-CarbonMonoxide.html
customer_reviews.author: diglloyd

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Recommended by a firefighter. Great backup for built in carbon monoxide detectors.
customer_reviews.author: CLEO STIREN

customer_reviews.title: Good quality detector for a fair price
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. Turn it on and leave it on. It will notify you if levels raise.
customer_reviews.author: Swayrc51

customer_reviews.title: This is a sweet little CO meter
customer_reviews.text: This is a sweet little CO meter. Easy to read and it appears to be accurate. Best part for me is that it is American made.
customer_reviews.author: Eric M.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: this is a really good unit. long battery life. very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Melton

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Using it in the cockpit. Works well and picks up the slightest traces of CO.
customer_reviews.author: Sven

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice unit that gives me a piece of mind when flying my 185 Skywagon.
customer_reviews.author: William M

customer_reviews.title: Money Waste
customer_reviews.text: A real money waste ... this thing worked fine for 20-25 times ... now it's reading +45 ppm in the fresh air ... in the car .. in my home .. in my friend's home, it's still showing false reading ... purchased on 2016 and kept it to use when needed, was fine at first but now !! it's a piece of junk .
customer_reviews.author: Sh_Biker

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Just a lite smaller than I thought it would be.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy W.

customer_reviews.title: Using this for a backup
customer_reviews.text: I am using this as a backup to my CO detector in my RV. I travel in the winter and use my furnace a lot. The alarm goes off if above 35. I'm happy with this. The background noise is the generator.
customer_reviews.author: Freya

customer_reviews.title: It will save your life
customer_reviews.text: Stays in my plane 24/7 always ready to go wouldn’t fly with out it
customer_reviews.author: Buddy

customer_reviews.title: Does it good like it should.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived promptly. Seems to work properly, as advertised. Like a Panda: eats shoots and leaves.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great device, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it is advertised to do. Great device, easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and a great price. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works well! My husband is a truck driver ...
customer_reviews.text: It works well! My husband is a truck driver in the oil field industry. This has helped him with suspected exhaust leaks in his truck, plus, onsite where generators, etc are operating. He clips it onto his shirt, along with his H2S monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Tejas Kat

customer_reviews.title: Is this thing on?
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed for the price. I think I received a defective unit and the seller never got back to me.
customer_reviews.author: moviescore1

customer_reviews.title: Profesional and very handy, Best customer service !
customer_reviews.text: Very sensitive, practical, a great product ! I use it all the time at my work. Profesional and robust . A great customer service. They will help you with anything. I am very glad I choose Sensorcon. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Amady

customer_reviews.title: Great American made tool
customer_reviews.text: Great American made tool! It's water proof, stays on throughout the day, it's small, I can either clip it to my shirt pocket or hang it on a lanyard, and it gives me reliable readings. It has everything I need. I just wish it had a LIGHT button; still a great tool for the price!
customer_reviews.author: mydleon1

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Much more compact than I'd expect for this type of sensor. Good for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Gypsy2222

customer_reviews.title: No backlit LCD screen?!
customer_reviews.text: Our evaluation Industrial Sensorcon CO meter arrived quickly, and it feels like a quality unit in the hand, however, we're deducting 3 stars for the lack of backlight on the display. It's almost 2017 for goodness sake - hard to believe there's no backlit LCD screen on this $100+ device when a $10 calculator offers it. It's impossible to read the screen in low light, and this is a deal-breaker. I won't be able to move forward with a bigger order as planned.
customer_reviews.author: Dillan

customer_reviews.title: Seems very well made
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a gift for my husband, so I can't review how well it works yet, but it came very fast and seems like a very solid unit. I will try to add some more to this review once he uses it.
customer_reviews.author: Poodle Mom

product_meta.title: Sensorcon Industrial CO Carbon Monoxide Monitor with Visual, Audible and Vibrating Alerts, Waterproof
product_meta.description:
Designed primarily for industrial and commercial applications, the Sensorcon INDUSTRIAL displays carbon monoxide (CO) concentrations as low as 1 ppm and features visual, audible and vibrating alerts, low level (35 ppm) and high level (200 ppm) alerts, and Intrinsically Safe certification. An easy to read LCD displays CO up to 1,999 ppm in 1 ppm increments with +/- 2% accuracy. Use as a personal monitor, ambient air monitor, or to inspect combustion equipment using the optional pump and probe. Unlike other similarly priced CO monitors, Sensorcon units are designed for long-term ownership. Replacement battery and calibration services are available. Manufacturer warranty is one year.


All Sensorcon units are low-level monitors which display carbon monoxide levels as low as 1 ppm. This particular model sounds the Low Level alert when carbon monoxide levels are measured from 35 to 199 ppm, and the High Level alert from 200 ppm and higher. 

Have questions? Please contact us through Amazon – we are here to help!
